Title: Sr. MES (Manufacturing Execution System) Lead
RoleDescription: Job Description Responsible for configuring, supporting, and optimizing Manufacturing Execution System (MES) functionalities in a manufacturing environment. Ensures accurate data collection from production equipment and alignment of system configurations with operational and quality requirements. Coordinates MES-related activities such as parameter setup, user access control, interface validation with automation and ERP systems, and master data consistency. Collaborates with production, quality, IT, and engineering teams to troubleshoot complex issues and lead continuous improvement initiatives. Additionally, supports audits, trains end users, and ensures compliance with global MES standards and traceability policies. Position is non-remote & requires on-site attendance Primary Duties and Accountabilities Serve as MES application owner for the plant, overseeing configuration, performance monitoring, and alignment between actual and target state. Provide MES subject matter expertise to evaluate, configure, and optimize Nexeed MES/IAS systems according to user and operational requirements. Lead the deployment of Nexeed MES/IAS, ensuring compliance with Bosch IT architecture, cybersecurity, and Industry 4.0 standards. Drive MES strategy execution, including penetration into brownfield and greenfield lines and alignment with digital manufacturing objectives. Ensure machine connectivity to MES for both legacy and new equipment, using Bosch connectivity solutions. Collaborate with production, quality, engineering, and IT to resolve MES issues, support audits, and ensure data integrity and traceability. Train and support end users on MES tools and promote adoption of best practices for system usage. Act as MES focal point during product launches, equipment commissioning, and relocation projects. Support and apply the MES process capability framework to enable standardization and continuous improvement at plant level.    Qualifications Basic Qualifications: Education: Bachelors degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related technical field. Minimum  7 years of experience supporting or configuring MES systems in a manufacturing environment. Hands-on experience with MES configuration, including user access control, parameter setup, and interface testing (e.g., ERP, PLCs, SCADA). Proficient in SQL and experienced in working with Oracle Databases for data validation, query execution, and system support. Solid understanding of manufacturing operations, traceability, and data integrity principles. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with production, quality, engineering, and IT teams. Strong troubleshooting skills and a structured, analytical mindset. Preferred Qualifications: Hands-on experience with Nexeed MES, preferably including the new Nexeed IAS platform. Familiarity with ISA-95 architecture and integration with automation systems via OPC UA or similar protocols. Working knowledge of SAP, especially in areas related to production and quality data integration. Experience supporting MES configurations during production launches, equipment commissioning, or plant relocations. Exposure to Linux environments for MES infrastructure monitoring and diagnostics. Experience leading or contributing to local MES improvement initiatives and standardization efforts. Relevant certifications (e.g., Nexeed MES training, Six Sigma, PMP) are considered an advantage.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability / veterans

Title: Customs and Foreign Trade Analyst
RoleDescription:
Are you a trade compliance expert with a keen eye for detail and a passion for navigating the complexities of global trade? Were seeking a knowledgeable and proactive Customs Compliance & Foreign Trade Analyst to support Bosch Groups trade operations across North America.In this role, you will play a critical part in ensuring seamless and compliant import/export transactions, including those within Foreign Trade Zones (FTZs). Youll conduct in-depth research, assess the effectiveness of trade compliance programs, and implement key compliance initiatives. Additionally, youll be responsible for preparing reports for North American GBs, supporting program implementation, and assisting management with the accurate and timely execution of international trade functions.Key Responsibilities:Trade Compliance Research & Enforcement: Conduct research on trade regulations, enforcement actions, and international trade agreements. Identify areas for improvement and provide recommendations to optimize operations.Program Implementation & Coordination: Oversee and implement various compliance-related programs. Coordinate and manage processes to ensure they are executed efficiently and in line with regulatory standards.Document Review & Compliance: Perform compliance reviews of import, export, and FTZ documentation, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of international shipments. Validate critical information such as Country of Origin, valuation, and OGA filings.Complex Transaction Management: Assist with complex import/export transactions, including valuation, provision schedules, and routing guidance. Help management ensure accurate and timely transactions for compliance with regulations.Customs and Regulatory Communication: Represent the Trade Compliance team by maintaining consultative communication with management and staff across multiple business functions. Address and resolve compliance-related inquiries promptly.Freight Forwarder & Customs Broker Support: Respond to inquiries from freight forwarders, customs brokers, and other vendors, ensuring timely clearance and compliance with documentation requirements for imports and exports.Vendor & Stakeholder Relationship Management: Maintain relationships with key partners, such as freight forwarders, customs brokers, and foreign suppliers, to ensure the efficient flow of tangible items and support compliance across the supply chain.Performance Metrics & Reporting: Generate performance metrics related to import/export processes and ensure the continuous improvement of compliance practices. Prepare reports and presentations for internal stakeholders.Process Improvement & Participation: Actively participate in process improvement initiatives, assisting in the identification and implementation of compliance best practices.Regulatory Monitoring & Updates: Monitor changes in trade regulations and legislative requirements. Communicate relevant updates to internal stakeholders and modify internal processes as needed.Customs Recordkeeping & Documentation: Manage and maintain customs records in compliance with CBP (Customs and Border Protection) regulations and the Foreign Trade Regulations (FTR), ensuring records are accurate and readily available for review.Support Compliance Department Activities: Provide support for other compliance-related activities and special projects as assigned by the Customs Compliance Manager or Director.Key Competencies:Consultative Communication: Effectively communicate with management and staff across various business functions, providing insights and recommendations on trade compliance matters.Operational Expertise: Perform daily operational tasks related to import and export compliance under supervision or in collaboration with senior team members.Trade Compliance Knowledge: Utilize expertise in international trade compliance operations, including the handling of import/export documentation, FTZ operations, and regulatory compliance.Regulatory Knowledge: Strong understanding of U.S. Customs regulations, foreign trade regulations, and international trade compliance, including experience with Country of Origin and valuation assessments.Problem Solving: Ability to respond to compliance inquiries and resolve issues related to import/export operations efficiently.Vendor & Relationship Management: Build and maintain positive working relationships with freight forwarders, customs brokers, and other key stakeholders to ensure the smooth movement of goods.Attention to Detail: Ensure the accuracy and completeness of import/export documentation and compliance records in line with regulatory requirements.Project & Process Management: Lead or participate in process improvement initiatives, manage complex projects, and contribute to overall operational efficiency.
